title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Claremont McKenna College
Interview Descriptions: Interview was difficult but good. Everyone was very nice and it wasn't something that they were out to get you for. Very considerate. A few tough questions here and there but it wasn't anything super crazy
Interview Questions: A few ratio based questions

title: Assistant Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Claremont McKenna College
Interview Descriptions: Met with Professor, chatted about experience and classes. Why interested in position, potential research topics. Future career plans and classes. Asked about expectations (hrs, times) and tools needed to work on the project.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this role?

title: Assistant Controller Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Claremont McKenna College
Interview Descriptions: Not easy, most difficult but they were kind and gracious. Very pointed questions, making it hard to generalize. My my my it was really really tough. They give you snacks while waiting.
Interview Questions: How long have you worked here?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Claremont McKenna College (Claremont, CA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very simple and professional. Easy to understand the whole way through and everyone was beyond helpful and kind. This was one of the first interviews I've ever done, and I was so surprised by how painless it was.
Interview Questions: What do you do on campus besides taking courses?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Claremont McKenna College (Claremont, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The process was relatively quick-- just a couple of weeks. I submitted a resume and cover letter, then interviewed in person. The interview was short and straightforward. It helps to get a recommendation from a Professor that already does research at the Lowe.
Interview Questions: Why [insert specific team]?

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Claremont McKenna College in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Didn't have one. I just emailed the head of the lab and he told me to apply on handshake. It was super easy, just a resume drop and cover letter.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Claremont McKenna College
Interview Descriptions: It was a simple referral to the hiring professor. We discussed a number of different things, our research, teaching philosophies, and content area related philosophies and issues. Just the one interview
Interview Questions: content knowledge

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Claremont McKenna College (Claremont, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Referred through a professor to his research team after taking a class that related to his research work - it was an informal and positive process. Highly recommend working as research assistant in undergrad at CMC
Interview Questions: Would you like to work here

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Claremont McKenna College (Claremont, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Communications came directly from the hiring manager by email. In those communications, that person handled them very well, was personable and even gave me good directions about how to find the building and where to park. It was a positive experience.
Interview Questions: I really don't remember, it was a while back. The questions did seem relevant to the position though.

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Claremont McKenna College (Claremont, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview with three people on speakerphone, one of whom I could barely hear.  There were supposed to be four, but one was a no-show.

I had the very strong sense that at least one of the interviewers already intended to hire an inside candidate, and thus that the interview was pretty much pro forma.  All three of them were taken aback when I had three real questions about how central tasks got done and the role of the advisory committee.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with disagreements among your program staff and with faculty invested in the program's trajectory and outcomes?

title: Student Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Claremont McKenna College (Claremont, CA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was referred from another Student Office Assistant and spoke to the main Administrative Assistant for an interview chat. I submitted my resume and completed a basic application. Within a week, I was accepted for the next school semester.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at FSW?

title: Web Content and Social Media Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Claremont McKenna College (Claremont, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I was hired as a college student. They posted the job openings they had on their website and shared on Facebook. I filled out the application and was accepted - I don't think there was an interview, at least not for me. Besides the routine information that goes on an application, they asked some additional questions (like why we wanted the particular position), so that may have been enough in lieu of an interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Claremont McKenna College (Claremont, CA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Short essay, interview with professors. I was asked to submit a short essay discussing why I wanted the research position and what I planned to do after graduation (this position is only available to current CMC students).
Interview Questions: Discuss a time when you worked on a difficult team?
